title: Data Scientist- GenAI
description:
**Arbetsområde:** Affärsutveckling
**Typ av tjänst:** Tillsvidare
**Placering:**Stockholm, Stockholms Län, Sverige
Do you also believe in everyone's right to affordable, good and sustainable food? Do you want to be part of a journey in an exciting industry where innovation, commitment and drive are important ingredients? Welcome to the Axfood family!  


Through our group's many brands, competencies and backgrounds, we have the power to make a difference together - for real. Now we are looking for you who want to be part of developing tomorrow's grocery trade.  


**Become one of us**

As a Data Scientist at Axfood AB you will be a part of Advanced Analytics which is a key component of our central department, Strategy & Business Development. Our team's mission is to establish Axfood as a leader in AI innovation within the grocery retail industry.  

We specialize in developing and maintaining end-to-end machine learning and advanced analytics pipelines, driving Axfood to become more data driven. Our team focuses on building models for various business units, including e-commerce, loyalty programs (e.g., Willys Plus, Klubb Hemköp), digital marketing, and broader AI initiatives across the Axfood group. We collaborate closely with IT, business developers, e-commerce specialists, and business analysts within the group.  

**This is what you will do**

As a Data Scientist, you’ll develop and productionize machine learning and analytical models that support different areas of Axfood’s business. The team you will be a part of work on predictive modelling, recommender systems, clustering algorithms and building AI solutions. In this role, you will focus on developing GenAI solutions to transform how we engage customers and deliver value across different areas of our business.  

  

You will work with a team of other Data Scientists, which means there will be good opportunities to grow and learn by working together. Working on a project usually involves end-to-end responsibility which means responsibility for project design, model development, productionizing pipelines, follow-up and maintenance. Therefore, it’s important to have a good collaboration with the team and other stakeholders. This responsibility also means that there is room for creativity in project design, and ultimately that you’ll have a direct impact on Axfood’s success.  

  

Being a Data Scientist at Axfood, you will be working with a modern, cloud-based platform to build models. You will develop models using Python and SQL for programming and mainly using AWS SageMaker and Airflow for development and orchestration of pipelines.  

**This is what we expect from you**

To excel in this role you need to have at least a couple years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer and have deep knowledge in machine learning/AI. We see that you have a degree in mathematics, computer science, physics, statistics, data science or equivalent engineering degree.  

  

You have deep knowledge in advanced modelling with different types of AI models - both traditional and generative - and a great interest in MLOps and building scalable code. We would also like to see that you have worked in projects building and delivering applications with generative AI and that you are excited about exploring new concepts in the world of data science and AI.  

  

As a person you are an analytical and creative problem solver with strong communication and collaboration skills. You’re proficient in English, both written and spoken. Knowledge of Swedish (verbal and written) is very desirable since the working language is Swedish.
**Preferred skills and experience:**
* Experience developing end-to-end machine learning solutions – from data preparation and model training to deployment and monitoring
* Experience with generative AI applications
* Proficiency in Python and SQL
* Working with large data sets
* Airflow (or similar) for orchestrating pipelines
* Version control (Git) and CI/CD tools (Bitbucket, GitHub or Gitlab)
* Working with cloud platforms such as AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP

  

The position is a permanent employment with a start date as soon as possible or by agreement. The placement is at our headquarters, Torsplan Stockholm.
**Additional information**
Do you fit the above profile? Do not hesitate to apply today! Applications are processed on a rolling basis and the position may be filled before the deadline of November 3. We only accept applications through our job pages.  

  

If you would like to know more about what the position entails, please contact: Björn Blomqvist, Head of AI-strategy, e-mail: bjorn.blomqvist@axfood.se.  


To find out if we are the right fit for each other, our recruitment process includes tests and interviews.
We also conduct background checks for all recruitments.The job application process at Axfood | Axfood  


Please note that during this process, we will not ask you to log in with your Bank ID, enter a password or scan a QR code. For further questions please contact our employee support at jobb@axfood.se  

  

**About Axfood**
The group consists of a family of brands and is unique in the Swedish market. At Axfood, we believe in everyone's right to affordable, good and sustainable food. It includes the retail chains Willys and Hemköp, as well as Tempo and Handlar'n. Wholesale sales are handled by Axfood Snabbgross and Dagab is responsible for the Group's product development, purchasing and logistics. Axfood also includes Urban Deli, as well as the partly-owned Apohem and Eurocash, City Gross and Mathem.
company_description: Axfood är ett av Sveriges ledande bolag inom dagligvaruhandeln. Hos oss finns spännande utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som vill vara med på resan när vi tar mat-Sverige in i framtiden.

title: Juniora Analysts till Operations, Engineering, AI & Data (Stockholm) - Aug 2025
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
-----------------------

Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Operations, Engineering, AI & Data stödjer våra klienter i att driva strategiska förändringsprojekt där vi implementerar affärsstrategier och utvecklar deras operationella förmågor för att hjälpa dem nå sina affärsmål. Vi arbetar med verksamhetsförändring där vi använder våra industrispecifika lösningar och tekniska kunskap för att transformera, modernisera och optimera våra klienters processer och tekniska plattformar.


**AI & Data:**

AI & Data-teamet hjälper våra kunder att förbättra beslutsfattande genom datadrivna insikter och skapa insiktsdrivna organisationer med hjälp av AI, analytics och data. Teamet arbetar med teknisk implementering av lösningar inom AI, GenAI, cloud data platforms, data warehouse, BI/analytics samt datakataloger och hantering av masterdata, men också med rådgivning inom dessa områden. Detta innefattar data och AI strategi samt -governance. Vi har starkt fokus på data science, där kompetenser inom maskininlärning, statistisk analys och modellering är centrala för att leverera avancerade insikter och affärsvärde. Vår modell är on-the-job-training där du växer in i mer ansvarsfulla roller, men du kommer också att vidareutbilda dig i olika tekniska plattformar, t.ex. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure, Snowflake och/eller Databricks. AI & Data-teamet verkar i en nordisk organisation med mycket kunskapskapital och kompetens så du kommer också att medverka i projekt, communities och utbildningar tillsammans med dina nordiska kollegor.


**Operations, Industry & Domain Solutions:**

Vi hjälper våra kunder att på ett innovativt sätt förändra sina organisationer. Detta kan innebära att driva större och mindre förändringsprojekt, förnya sin operativa modell, implementera nya system och processer eller förbättra sin effektivitet. Vårt team fokuserar primärt på bank- och försäkring där vi arbetar tillsammans med flertalet av Nordens största banker och försäkringsbolag, samt hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn.


Vi arbetar ofta ihop i projektteam med en stark laganda, där du som Analyst spelar en viktig roll och arbetar nära kunden. Som Analyst kommer du att driva analysarbete, stötta i framtagandet av presentationsmaterial och tillsammans med ditt team hjälpa kunden att lyckas med sin förändringsresa. Du får möjlighet att arbeta nära och lära dig av våra erfarna kollegor om olika industrier och hur man arbetar med affärsutveckling, och inte minst hjälpa våra kunder att adressera spännande tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar.


**Engineering:**

Hos Engineering-teamet kommer ditt fokus ligga på att stärka våra kunders helhetsresa genom att leverera plattforms- och Cloudfunktioner, samt hjälpa våra kunder se transformation som en affärsmöjlighet och konkurrensfördel på marknaden. Vi utnyttjar vår tekniska expertis inom specifika branschsektorer och domänledda approacher för att skapa fördelar för våra kunder genom unika tjänster, produkter och lösningar. Vårt erbjudande inkluderar utveckling av strategier, migrationsplanering, modernisering av applikationer samt utveckling av plattformar och produkter.


Som Analyst i vårt team kommer du att vara en del av våra kunders resa genom att stötta vid framtagande av presentationsmaterial och bidra till utveckling av strategier, delta i kundmöten samt göra research. Du kommer att skaffa dig erfarenhet både genom kundprojekt men även genom att delta vid branschevent, specialiserad utbildning och certifieringsprogram.


**Kravspecifikation**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad ingenjör eller ekonom med en masterexamen inom management, data/data science/analytics eller finans. För att trivas bra i rollen bör du även vara utåtriktad och initiativrik samt drivs av nya utmaningar.


Vidare ser vi gärna att du innehar:


* Goda studieresultat, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher

Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.


**Ytterligare information**
---------------------------

**Vi erbjuder**

Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i ett team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och som är i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär samt kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.


**Ansökan**

Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:


* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.

Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval.


Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/ . För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.


**Frågor**

Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Maria Brengdahl Bengtsson, mbrengdahlbengtsson@deloitte.se .


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**What impact will you make?**

På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.


**Arbetsplats**
---------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
* **Position overview**

Our business, which provides leading software solutions and consulting services, is growing at a fast pace. To build on this momentum, we’re looking for Product Marketing Managers across various portfolios to be part of our Global Marketing group.

In this role, you’ll work closely with our technical Product Managers to analyze the market/client needs and experiences, determine how to articulate client challenges effectively, understand the products’ unique selling points, and help us to develop sales tools and marketing material, including writing technical marketing content. You’ll do product and competitor research, help to determine and implement the go-to-market strategy, and provide source material for sales and marketing.

If you have a strong technical/IT background in SAP and are enthusiastic about marketing, we’d love to hear from you.

* **Responsibilities**
* Work in tandem with Product Managers to determine and implement the go-to-market strategy for a range of products/service lines, specifically developing messaging and market positioning
* Perform market research, and act as the voice of the client by analyzing specific client concerns and communicating these internally, as well as understanding how our solutions solve these challenges
* Undertake competitor analysis and product positioning, and monitor key market trends
* Communicate the vision and value of products to marketing and sales colleagues, and develop tools that facilitate the process
* Perform surveys, interviews and focus groups to obtain insights about the client’s product usage and buyer personas to tap new opportunities
* Write technical content for sales and marketing purposes, including ebooks, white papers, blogs, lead magnets and web pages
* Plan, develop and provide content for global marketing campaigns that can be leveraged by Regional Marketing Leads and Partners
* Communicate campaign objectives, timelines, and deliverables to the broader team, and provide instructions for use or promotion
* Ensure that campaigns achieve expected results, and prepare activity reports and metrics to demonstrate outcomes
* Identify improvements for processes, content, and lead generation
* Collaborate closely with Regional Marketing Leads to support meetings, events, conferences, and trade shows, and ensure these are in line with the go-to-market strategy
* Support the implementation of the company’s brand strategy.

**Qualification required**

Bachelor’s degree (or higher), or equivalent

**Experience and skills required**

* Extensive IT experience
* Technical background in ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) software or similar
* Understanding of SAP, SAP SuccessFactors and related systems
* Excellent collaborative skills and the ability to work with multiple teams and departments across the business
* Excellent market research skills and the ability to gain insight into our clients’ needs
* Commercially driven mindset with demonstrable business acumen
* Accurate analytical skills for evaluating and discovering effective marketing strategies
* Experience in writing technical IT marketing and sales source content
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Self-motivated with strong client focus
* Understanding of marketing principles and experience in implementing successful data-driven marketing campaigns
* Excellent time management and organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.

**The following would be an advantage:** 

* Demonstrable experience in product marketing
* Understanding of and experience in one or more of the following:
* SAP S/4HANA and System Landscape Optimization (SLO)
* SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) and custom code
* SAP Application Lifecycle Management product solutions, Test Data Management, decommissioning systems
* Data privacy and security, and GRC (Governance, Risk and Compliance)
* Cloud solutions including migrations, hosting, managed services and AWS
* Human Capital Management (HCM)/ Human Experience Management (HXM), HR and Payroll reporting

**What do we value?** 

* Demonstrating mutual respect and empathy towards our colleagues and our clients
* Acting with integrity, professionalism and personal humility
* Showing enthusiasm, being dedicated and innovative, and having fun.

**Position**

* Full-time permanent position
* Based at the EPI-USE Labs office in Manchester
* Hybrid working, with three days per week in the office
* The role will include minimal travel.

**Compensation and benefits**

* Market-related salary, taking qualifications and experience into account
* Other benefits include mobile/broadband allowance, pension, private medical insurance, office gym, regular social events, flexible working

**About EPI-USE Labs**

With over 40 years of experience, is a global company providing software solutions and managed services to over 1,600 clients across 49 countries. We help our clients transform their SAP landscapes, and optimize the performance, management and security of their SAP and SAP SuccessFactors systems. We simplify and speed up landscape and test data management, enable data security, privacy and compliance, provide efficient cloud solutions and managed services, deliver effective Human Experience Management (HXM) and much more.

EPI-USE Labs is a member of .

Within our company, our culture is inspirational, forward-thinking, and family-oriented. We aim to be seen by our clients as honest, trustworthy and sincere in our commitment to enhancing their business.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: 60 000,00kr - 90 000,00kr per month

Experience:

* Technology Marketing: 5 years (Required)

Work authorization:

* Sweden (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Veeva Development Cloud Manager
description:
**Company Description** ***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***


At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.


Here at Sobi, our mission and culture get us excited to come to work every day, but here are a few more reasons to join our team:

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments

  

**Job Description**  

We are now searching for a Veeva Development Cloud Managerto join our IS/IT team. The IS/IT department is managed in-house and act as a strategic enabler for the implementation as well as the support and maintenance of business systems at Sobi.


As a Veeva Development Cloud Manager, you will be part of the Veeva Development Team within the Information System organization. The team supports Sobi’s quality systems i.e., the new Veeva systems for Regulatory, Quality and Clinical etc. You will be system administrator in the Veeva Clinical systems that was implemented at Sobi in 2023. This position has high visibility across the company and interacts globally with many departments as well as with external partners.


Sobi is a dynamic and growing company with a high pace of change. This requires well-functioning and up to date IT and business systems to support Sobi’s business strategies, and to ensure that we are fulfilling regulatory requirements applicable for the pharmaceutical industry.

**Key Responsibilities**


Your main areas of responsibility will be the work with our new Veeva Clinical systems CDMS and eTMF, which are used by our Clinical Teams, CRO’s and other external parties. You will act as system administrator and participate and lead new development projects and take care of day-to-day system maintenance and enhancements. You will work together with the rest of the team to handle the regular system updates in form of releases and act as a center of competence for the Veeva systems. As Sobi is in an exciting growth phase, there will be good opportunities to influence and shape this role**.**

**Example of projects/areas to lead/support are:**

* Maintain, develop and follow agreed system management practices.
* Responsibility for and holding user training (incl. Producing educational material).
* Responsible for operational management and administration of the systems and its users.
* Responsible for and run administrative governance boards for respective system.
* Second line support.
* Collaborate with both internal and external parties; system owners, system suppliers, IS/IT, users etc.
* Responsible for planning, management and implementation of changes.
* Lead and/or participate in projects and validations.
* Monitor regulatory requirements and technical solutions regarding Computer Compliance.
* Collaborate with and support other system managers within the team.


Reporting to: Head of Veeva Development

 **Qualifications** **About you**


You bring a strong background in clinical operations, quality, or related fields, with a natural interest in system development. You're a superuser of systems, a problem-solver at heart, and are passionate about ensuring smooth, compliant operations. Your collaborative spirit and ability to manage and drive change will make you a vital part of our team.

* Experience of working with GxP systems as a system administrator, super user, project manager, validation leader, consultant or similar.
* Strong problem-solving capabilities and ability to convert complex business requirements into robust system solutions.
* Knowledge of Clinical applications and/or processes is a plus, as well as knowledge in document management systems.
* University Education in Computer Science, Business Administration, Project Management or similar knowledge.
* Excellent communication skills in English are a must.
* Experience from the Pharmaceutical Industry will be considered a plus.

  

**Additional Information**  

All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.

**Why Join Us?**  

  

We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.  

  

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.  

  

**Sobi Culture**  

  

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.  

  

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.
company_description: Our mission here at Sobi is to develop and deliver innovative therapies and services to improve life for people living with rare diseases.

title: Vi söker glada receptionister för anställning varannan helg
description:
**Gothia Towers är en plats för möten och upplevelser för människor från hela världen. Ett fyrstjärnigt hotell med 1200 smakfullt inredda rum och magnifik utsikt över staden samt flera populära restauranger och barer med något för alla smaker. Här finns över 40 000 kvadratmeter upplevelseyta för fest, evenemang, show, konferens och kongress – allt under ett tak. Gothia Towers är en del av Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers.**


Inför vintern behöver vi fylla på vårt fantastiska team i Front Office med ett par nya stjärnor! Har du en sprudlande personlighet, hög arbetsmoral och älskar att ge personlig service - då tror vi du passar hos oss!

**Kvalifikationer och personlighet**  

Vi söker dig som har ett högt engagemang och som trivs med att jobba i team. Vi ser att du är driven, strukturerad och noggrann. Du gillar att ge service och är lyhörd för vad gästen vill ha. Du tycker om att arbeta i ett högt tempo och kan ta tag i arbetsuppgifter där det behövs.


Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från receptionsarbete på hotell, men även andra delar av hotell- och servicebranschen är meriterande. Du kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift, både på svenska och engelska och ytterligare språk ses som meriterande. Har du arbetat med bokningssystemet Opera och/eller Opera Cloud tidigare är det ett plus. Vi sätter stort värde på att intresse och engagemang finns och personlig lämplighet är avgörande.

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

I rollen som receptionist är du den som möter gästen vid ankomst och ser till att gästen får ett trevligt bemötande, rätt information och service under sin vistelse hos oss. Arbetet innebär dagligt receptionsarbete såsom in- och utcheckning, merförsäljning och administrativt arbete ex. fakturering. Du har löpande kontakt och samarbete med flera avdelningar i huset såsom t ex Housekeeping och Bokning.

**Om tjänsten**  

Tjänsten är på 20%. Vi ser gärna att du även vill jobba på en högre tjänstgöringsgrad under ex. jul- och sommarlov.


Arbetstiden kan vara förlagd till fredag kväll, lördag och söndag. Vanligtvis två dagar varannan helg.


Sista ansökningsdag är 25 oktober, men tänk på att rekrytering sker löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan! Vi ser gärna att du kan starta din introduktion så snart som möjligt.

**Frågor om tjänsten** kontakta Lovisa Svan, Front Office Manager, lovisa.svan@gothiatowers.com.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**

 *Från hjärtat av Göteborg erbjuder Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers allt från stora mässor och event till oförglömliga hotell- och restaurangupplevelser. Vår verksamhet innefattar många starka varumärken som tillsammans skapar en unik och attraktiv mötesplats där vi varje år välkomnar nästan två miljoner besökare. Som medarbetare hos oss jobbar du tillsammans med ett stort, engagerat och sammansvetsat gäng och är med och utvecklar vår verksamhet, både nu och för framtiden. Inom Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers strävar vi efter en mångfald hos våra medarbetare och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande kultur. Bli en del av vår värld – det är här vi skapar upplevelser för livet.*  

*Läs mer om oss på www.svenskamassan.se och www.gothiatowers.com.*

*Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 20% | Ort: Göteborg | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/59 | Kontakt: Lovisa Svan 031-7088809, Amanda Grahn 031-7088089, | Publicerat: 2024-10-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-25*

title: Kommunikatör med ansvar för sociala medier
description:
Uddevalla – en plats för hela livet Välkommen att bli en del av vår växande kommun - och att tillsammans med oss arbeta för att ge våra kommuninvånare ännu bättre service. Vi erbjuder en attraktiv arbetsplats som ger dig stora möjligheter att utvecklas i din yrkesroll. Vårt mål är att alla ska kunna trivas och växa - under ett helt yrkesliv. Vi vill också utvecklas som arbetsgivare och arbetar aktivt för att på bästa sätt ta till vara på din kunskap och ditt engagemang. Vi uppskattar och uppmuntrar till medskapande från alla. Uddevalla kommun är en vacker plats vid havet i hjärtat av Bohuslän. Vi tror på ett öppet och positivt samspel mellan kommun, utbildning, näringsliv och kultur. Vi hoppas att du kommer att trivas hos oss!

**Vi behöver förstärka vår kommunikationsavdelning med ytterligare en stjärna! Letar du efter ett omväxlande och utvecklande arbete inom kommunikation och sociala medier? Då är rollen som kommunikatör med ansvar för sociala medier en perfekt match för dig!**

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
====================


För det första så erbjuder vi ett roligt, meningsfullt och omväxlande arbete med positiva, stöttande och härliga kollegor! Dessutom får du möjlighet att vara en stor och viktig del i vårt framtida kommunikationsarbete genom att vara den som leder och utvecklar vår närvaro i sociala medier. Sociala medier är en viktig kanal för oss och vi tror att du besitter kunskaper som vi behöver.

**Om jobbet**
=============


Du arbetar tätt tillsammans med dina kommunikatörskollegor med alla typer av kommunikation men du kommer ha det övergripande ansvaret för våra officiella sociala medier-kanaler. Du kommer planera och utveckla vår närvaro på sociala medier och hålla dig uppdaterad gällande trender, lagar och förändringar. Vi hjälps åt att producera och publicera innehåll men du kontrollerar att allt innehåll följer de strategier, rutiner och regler som finns. I din roll kommer du även att ha en samordnande funktion, och fungera som ett stöd för övriga förvaltningar i frågor rörande sociala medier.


Utöver arbetet med sociala medier kommer du tillsammans med dina kollegor på avdelningen vara en del i det dagliga arbetet med kommunens externa och interna kommunikation, i alla våra övriga kanaler. Det kan till exempel innebära att skriva nyhets- och informationstexter, fotografera, göra film, uppdatera våra hemsidor, arbeta med event och kampanjer samt kommunikationsplanering och -rådgivning, internt och externt. Vi hjälps åt för att skapa så bra intern och extern kommunikation som möjligt för våra medborgare och kollegor!


Vi siktar högt och vår närvaro på sociala medier är oerhört viktig för oss. Därför letar vi efter dig som har viljan, kunskapen och intresset att hjälpa oss att bli ännu bättre.

**Arbetsuppgifter**
===================

* Övergripande ansvar för och samordning av våra sociala medier-kanaler, från strategi och utveckling till analys.
* Ansvarig för att strategier, rutiner och regler kopplade till sociala medier finns på plats, följs och hålls uppdaterade.
* Säkerställa att allt innehåll; text, bild och film följer lagar och riktlinjer.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad på trender, lagar och förändringar inom digital kommunikation och informera dina kollegor om dessa.
* Skapa innehåll till våra sociala medier-kanaler, till exempel textförfattande, bild- och videoredigering.
* Övrigt kommunikationsarbete, till exempel skriva och publicera interna och externa nyheter och informationstexter, kommunikationsplanering och stöttning.

**Vi tror att du är**
=====================

* Nyfiken och nytänkande med ett stort intresse för sociala medier och den utveckling som sker inom digitala medier.
* En duktig skribent som kan anpassa sättet att skriva efter budskap, syfte och målgrupp.
* Självgående, strategisk, kreativ och idérik.
* En lösnings orienterad lagspelare med ledaregenskaper som trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra och inte har några problem att hjälpa till där det behövs.

**Kvalifikationer**
===================

* Högskoleexamen inom digital kommunikation eller liknande utbildning/erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdigt.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av digital kommunikation och sociala medier.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa och hantera innehåll för olika digitala plattformar.
* Förmåga att anpassa innehåll efter målgrupp och plattform.
* Kunskap om lagar och regler kopplade till digital kommunikation, till exempel Dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR), Lagen om tillgänglighet till digital offentlig service, Upphovsrätt.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med Google AdWords, Analytics, Ads Manager för Meta.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med Adobe Creative Cloud programmen och Office-paketet.


Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en politiskt styrd organisation är en fördel men vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Har du arbetat i Sitevision (webbpubliceringsverktyg), Ungapped (verktyg för eventplanering och nyhetsbrev) eller liknande verktyg tidigare ses även det som en fördel men det är inget krav.

**Övrigt**
----------


Arbetsprov och referenser kan komma att efterfrågas.


Anställning sker under förutsättning att erforderliga beslut fattas. För tjänster där arbetet innebär direkt och regelbunden kontakt med barn och ungdomar, samt för verksamhet inom LSS, vård- och omsorg, hälso-och sjukvård, psykiatrisk vård och missbruksvård, ska giltigt utdrag ur polisens belastningsregister visas upp alternativt lämnas in före anställning. Tänk på att det kan ta tid att få utdraget så beställ det i god tid för att rekryteringsprocessen inte ska fördröjas. När du söker ett jobb hos oss sparas din ansökan. Det beror på att vi är en offentlig verksamhet. Din ansökan blir en allmän handling när vi har mottagit den. Det innebär att ansökningshandlingar och information om vem som sökt en tjänst kan begäras ut av den som vill. Om du har skyddad identitet ska du inte göra din ansökan digitalt utan kontakta den som står som kontaktperson i annonsen. För dig som inte är medborgare inom EU/EES-området krävs arbetstillstånd, detta gäller inte dig som har permanent uppehållstillstånd. Arbetstillståndet ska uppvisas vid intervjutillfället. Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Uddevalla | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/463 | Kontakt: Maria Sjunnesson +46522695124, | Publicerat: 2024-10-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-27

title: Digital Workplace transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Role** – Industry Principal/Digital Workplace Transformation Leader  

**Skill** - Digital Workplace Transformation Leader  

**Location** – Sweden  

**Compensation** – Competitive (including bonus)  

  

**Job Description:**  

The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
  

  

**Your role**  

In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernisation, organisational change and smart workspace design.  

  

**Role and Responsibilities:*** Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.

**Required - Mandatory:**  

* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –

Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
  

  

**Personal**  

Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.

  

**Why Infosys**  

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  

  

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.
company_description: Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Arbetsområde:** Affärsutveckling
**Typ av tjänst:** Tillsvidare
**Placering:**Stockholm, Stockholms Län, Sverige
Do you also believe in everyone's right to affordable, good and sustainable food? Do you want to be part of a journey in an exciting industry where innovation, commitment and drive are important ingredients? Welcome to the Axfood family!  


Through our group's many brands, competencies and backgrounds, we have the power to make a difference together - for real. Now we are looking for you who want to be part of developing tomorrow's grocery trade.  

**Become one of us**

As a Data Scientist at Axfood AB you will be a part of Advanced Analytics which is a key component of our central department, Strategy & Business Development. Our team's mission is to establish Axfood as a leader in AI innovation within the grocery retail industry.
We specialize in developing and maintaining end-to-end machine learning and advanced analytics pipelines, driving Axfood to become more data driven. Our team focuses on building models for various business units, including e-commerce, loyalty programs (e.g., Willys Plus, Klubb Hemköp), digital marketing, and broader AI initiatives across the Axfood group. We collaborate closely with IT, business developers, e-commerce specialists, and business analysts within the group.  

**This is what you will do**

As a Data Scientist, you’ll develop and productionize machine learning and analytical models that support different areas of Axfood’s business. Our work includes predictive modelling, recommender systems, clustering algorithms, and generative AI applications.  


You will work with a team of other Data Scientists, which means there will be good opportunities to grow and learn by working together. Working on a project usually involves end-to-end responsibility which means responsibility for project design, model development, productionizing pipelines, follow-up and maintenance. Therefore, it’s important to have a good collaboration with the team and other stakeholders. This responsibility also means that there is room for creativity in project design, and ultimately that you’ll have a direct impact on Axfood’s success.  


Being a Data Scientist at Axfood, you will be working with a modern, cloud-based platform to build models. You will develop models using Python and SQL for programming and mainly using AWS SageMaker and Airflow for development and orchestration of pipelines.  

**This is what we exect from you**

We believe you have at least a couple of years’ experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with a solid foundation in AI/ML theory and hands-on experience. You also have a degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, mathematics or equivalent experience.  


You excel at problem-solving, cross-collaboration with other teams and stakeholders and translating business needs into data science projects that can run in production. You have a scientific mindset, appreciate the importance of sound theory and have the skills to build robust and scalable code. You strive to create tangible value with the models you build.  


As a person you are an analytical and creative problem solver with strong communication and collaboration skills. You’re proficient in English, both written and spoken. Knowledge of Swedish (verbal and written) is very desirable since the working language is Swedish.  


**Preferred skills and experience:**
* Working with large data sets
* Developing machine learning models (predictive modelling, recommender systems, clustering etc.)
* Productionizing model pipelines, from data preparation and model training to deployment and monitoring (end-to-end)
* Uplift modelling (modelling individual treatment effects)
* A/B testing
* Proficiency in SQL and Python
* Airflow (or similar) for orchestrating pipelines
* Version control (Git) and CI/CD tools (Bitbucket, GitHub or Gitlab)
* Working with cloud platforms such as AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP
* Working with Jira

  


The position is a permanent employment with a start date as soon as possible or by agreement. The placement is at our headquarters, Torsplan Stockholm.  

**Additional Information**
Do you fit the above profile? Do not hesitate to apply today! Applications are processed on a rolling basis and the position may be filled before the deadline of November 3. We only accept applications through our job pages.  

  

If you would like to know more about what the position entails, please contact: Björn Blomqvist, Head of AI-strategy e-mail: bjorn.blomqvist@axfood.se.  


To find out if we are the right fit for each other, our recruitment process includes tests and interviews.  

We also conduct background checks for all recruitments. The job application process at Axfood | Axfood  

  

Please note that during this process, we will not ask you to log in with your Bank ID, enter a password or scan a QR code. For further questions please contact our employee support at jobb@axfood.se  


**About Axfood**  

  

The group consists of a family of brands and is unique in the Swedish market. At Axfood, we believe in everyone's right to affordable, good and sustainable food. It includes the retail chains Willys and Hemköp, as well as Tempo and Handlar'n. Wholesale sales are handled by Axfood Snabbgross and Dagab is responsible for the Group's product development, purchasing and logistics. Axfood also includes Urban Deli, as well as the partly-owned Apohem and Eurocash, City Gross and Mathem.
company_description: Axfood är ett av Sveriges ledande bolag inom dagligvaruhandeln. Hos oss finns spännande utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som vill vara med på resan när vi tar mat-Sverige in i framtiden.

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**The Position**



The Technical Product Manager will play a pivotal role in driving the strategic vision and development of our platform teams. This person will be responsible for shaping and executing product roadmaps that optimize the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of our infrastructure while enhancing the developer experience across the organization.

  

Working closely with cross-functional teams, the Technical Product Manager will bridge the gap between engineering, business, and customer stakeholders. They will ensure that our platform aligns with the overall company strategy while delivering value to our internal and external customers.

  

This role demands a strong technical background, excellent communication skills, and the ability to lead and inspire diverse teams in a fast-paced, agile environment. If you're passionate about building robust infrastructure and empowering developers with world-class tools, we invite you to help us drive innovation and excellence.

 **What is in it for you**


We are committed to creating an inclusive and values based culture where everyone feels that they belong, and where everyone has the opportunity to do meaningful work.



We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:


* 30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
* 1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
* 1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
* Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
* Paternity Leave
* Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
* Remote Office Budget
* Internet Allowance
* Development Plan & Budget
* Stock Appreciation Rights
* 2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave



Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.  

  

**What you will do**

* Become the product bridge between the operational part of the organisation and the rest of product engineering
* Co-create and define the Product Roadmap for the platform teams


* Align stakeholders around the platform progress outcomes


* Provide context and guidance, empower your team to have impactful results
* Communicate platform product vision, strategy, and progress to leadership and stakeholders
* Shaping the organisation, by using your influence, drives innovation and adoption of our services. By doing this you will help steer the company towards even greater impact. Ask insightful questions to determine the “what” and the “why” of our priorities
* Prioritise product outcomes and capabilities based on research and data analysis
* Collaborate closely with the engineering team leads
* Define team goals/targets
* Clarify technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and vice versa
* Work closely with engineers and architects to ensure products meet reliability, scalability, and security standards on complex technical topics
* Collaborate with software engineering teams to help drive project execution
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement

 **What you will need**

  

* Solid understanding of infrastructure, networking, cloud computing (preferably AWS), and system architecture
* Ability to act on risks, opportunities and impediments
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, automation, infrastructure as code (IaC), and observability practices
* Collaborative mindset, with experience in stakeholder engagement and excellent communication skills
* Proven experience in developing product strategies, and roadmaps, that accelerate value delivery
* Experience around OKR setting and maintaining
* Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies to improve cross-team collaboration and product delivery
* Proven ability to develop and manage complex software products with your team(s)
* Creativity in problem-solving with a focus on delivering effective and innovative technical solutions.

 **Who we are**

  

Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.

  

We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand-side response services.

  

In 2022, Sympower became a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

  

Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees!

  

Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

 **MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.**
company_description: Sympower is a cleantech scaleup driven by the mission of shaping an intelligent and green power system via advanced flexibility software solutions that enhance the value of energy assets.

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Growth
description:
MongoDB's mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhere—on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, it's no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.


### **About The Role**



We're looking for a hardworking, driven individual with superb energy, passion and initiative for new business acquisition. The Enterprise Account Executive role focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a sales strategy within an assigned territory, resulting in revenue growth and new customer acquisition.



We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Stockholm for our hybrid working model.


### **About The Sales Culture**



MongoDB is always developing and innovating — not only in our technology, but also in our sales go-to-market strategy. Our sales leadership is committed to building the best salesforce in technology. This means, inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team. We not only equip you to be successful and close deals, but we want your feedback and input on how we can continue to "Think Big and Go Far." As a crucial part of the Sales team at MongoDB, you will have access to a lucrative market and learn how to sell from some of the most successful sales leaders in the software industry.


### **What you will be doing**


* Proactively, identify, qualify and close a sales pipeline
* Strategically prospect into CTOs, Engineering/IT Leaders, & technical end users
* Build strong and effective relationships, resulting in growth opportunities
* Partner with our Solution Architects and work closely with the Professional Services team to achieve customer satisfaction
* Work closely with the enterprise ecosystem partner sales and channel partner to maximize deal sizes
* Participate in our sales enablement trainings, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamp, sophisticated sales training, and leadership and development programs

### **What you will bring to the table**


* 7 + years field experience of quota-carrying experience in a fast-paced and competitive market
* 4 + years in Enterprise SAAS sales
* Proven track of selling complex solutions into complex global organizations.
* Demonstrated ability to open new accounts and run a complex sales process
* A proven track record of overachievement and hitting sales targets
* Ability to articulate the business value of complex enterprise technology
* Skilled in building business champions
* Driven and competitive. Possess a strong desire to be successful
* Fluent in Swedish and English

### **Things we love**


* Passionate about growing your career in the largest market in software (database)
* Previous Sales Methodology training (e.g. MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales)
* Familiarity with databases, develops and open source technology a plus

### **Why join now**


* MongoDB invests 8x the industry average in development of each of our new hires & continuous career development
* Accelerators up to 30%
* Best in breed Sales trainings in MEDDIC and Command of the Message, including our comprehensive Sales Bootcamps and development programs
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
* Generous and competitive benefits (parental leave, fertility & wellbeing support)
* Friendly and inclusive workplace culture - Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB


To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we're committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees' wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it's like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!



MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.



MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**TLDR; We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with a strong interest in software development. We are a small team in Stockholm that work tightly together - and have lots of fun while trying to save the world. Join us!**

### **Want To Help Fight Climate Change?**


Do you believe that stopping climate change is possible and want to work passionately to make it happen? Then you might be the person we are looking for. GoClimate is founded on the belief that we can solve the climate crisis and is driven by our mission to make it so easy to act on stopping climate change that everyone can contribute to it.

### **The Job**


We’re looking for a person to help us develop our tool for businesses which automatically turns financial data into actionable climate information.


In this job, you will

* work with the full lifecycle of our ML models for data extraction and classification
* be involved in everything from data cleanup and labeling to development and maintenance of new and existing ML models
* dive into data to explore and implement solutions that increase our system’s performance
* help thousands of companies with their sustainability work and make a huge positive impact on the planet
* use Python as your main programming language
* work in a cross-functional team that goes beyond just development


Since we’re a small team with flexible roles other responsibilities could be relevant to add to this position, depending on your areas of interest and experience.

### **Working With Us**


We're an organization driven by our purpose: to fight climate change. We call ourselves a social enterprise, by which we mean that this purpose –not profit– will always be our most important measure of success.


In addition to working towards a sustainable climate, we believe strongly in a sustainable work environment. We continuously find the building blocks that we need within the team, to balance steady progress with the ability to live a rich life outside of work, whether that means flexible work hours or something else.


We’re looking for someone preferably based in Stockholm, where the majority of our team members are located. Our team is currently split between Stockholm and Åre, Sweden.


We don’t want you to just “fit in” to our current work culture. We want you to help us shape it. Taking in a new team member is the best chance we have to increase creativity and add new perspectives, so we encourage you to highlight other strengths than those required.

### **What We Offer**

* A team working together with you to slow down climate change in a big way.
* Lead the way. Our organization is structured without bosses with the expectation that we’re all leaders in our own different areas.
* Flexible work hours. Our foundation is 30 hours per week.
* Flexible work location. We value collaborating in person with a minimum of 2 days at the Stockholm office, but outside of that, we all work when and where it makes the most sense.


### **What We Expect from You**


Because of the way we work, we’re looking for a person who has:

* More than 2 years of experience of machine learning in production - preferably in Google Cloud and with Python but your general software experience and curiosity are more important than specific skills
* Strong Swedish skills - since most of the data we work with is in Swedish you need to be proficient in Swedish
* A strong interest and preferably experience in software development
* The ability to self-direct your work with our purpose in mind
* A preference for working as part of a team

  

To be a good fit for this position, we believe you are good or interested in:

  

* Growing your skillset together with your teammates by sharing knowledge and experience
* Sustainability - the data we classify and work with have different impacts on the environment, so an interest in why and how this works is very helpful for this role


We’re looking for someone that has experience in ML in production systems, but the right fit for the team and our mission is more important than specific previous experience.


—


We value diverse backgrounds, personalities and perspectives and encourage applications from people of all walks of life. You can send your application in either English or Swedish.


We aim at closing for new applications October 30th.


If you have any questions, please get in touch with us at our team email hello@goclimate.com. We look forward to your application!

title: CRM Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
**About the Role**


We are on the lookout for a CRM Marketing Automation Specialist to join our client’s team. In this role, you'll navigate the fast currents of a dynamic work environment, managing local and global send-outs. You’ll take the lead on projects and ongoing development as a marketing automation expert while ensuring the continuous maintenance and optimization of our client’s existing setup.


Ready to make waves? This could be your perfect catch!

 **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Develop and implement marketing automation strategies, managing and optimizing journeys to ensure effective communication with contacts and customers
* Work with the CRM Commercial team to provide expertise in Marketing Cloud for global projects, focusing on customer lifecycle phases like “Order to Delivery” and “Ownership"
* Create and maintain emails, cloud pages, and other content in Marketing Cloud
* Manage segmentation and send communication to existing contacts and customers
* Set up and manage trigger-based journeys for better customer engagement
* Support markets with best practices, tools, and execution of local campaigns
* Perform regular testing, improvements, and optimizations of journeys, ensuring data accuracy and testing capabilities
* Collaborate with CRM Systems on continuous Marketing Cloud enhancements
* Document technical setups, including data rules, SQL, automations, AMP scripts, and more to support the overall structure

Provide training and maintain guidelines and documentation for Marketing Cloud use  
* 

**Your** **profile**

  

We are seeking a driven and proactive professional who thrives working independently and can adapt swiftly in dynamic environments. You possess strong analytical skills, a keen attention to detail, and a continuous improvement mindset. Your excellent communication skills enable effective collaboration across teams and markets, where you apply a solution-oriented approach. Additionally, you have the capability to train and guide others, ensuring the implementation of best practices.


**Requirements**

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Certification as a Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist (other certifications are a plus)

Proven experience in marketing automation and CRM systems  
* 

**Does this sound like you?** If so, let's get in touch!
  

  

**Start**: December  

**Workload**: 100%  

**Duration**: 9 months  

**Location**: At the client's office in Gothenburg or remotely  

**Last day to apply**: 14 October  

**Contact**: veronica@fiskenivattnet.se

Welcome to a thoughtful consultant agency with a variety of specialists for contemporary communication and marketing. For us, it's about conveying meaningful contexts where both you and we feel like the "fish in the water".

title: Seize Your Summer Intern with Europe's leading cloud software company in 2024
description:
Imagine spending your summer collaborating with some of the brightest minds in the tech industry, where your ideas are welcomed and encouraged. The Visma summer internship program is your ticket to gaining hands-on experience, shaping future technologies, and setting the stage for a meaningful career in tech.

### **About us**


Visma is a collective of nearly 200 companies spread across 33 countries. Together we’re on a mission to improve the work-life of millions of people worldwide by developing and delivering software that simplifies complex processes.  

  

What's the best part? When you work at Visma, you get the best of both worlds: the feeling of a local startup with the perks of belonging to Europe's leading software company.  

  

**What you can expect**  

Based on your background and preferences, you’ll join one of our companies to work on a project in key areas such as Software Engineering, AI development, and Business development. From day one, you’ll be an essential member of your assigned team, contributing to strategically important projects to drive our company forward. You'll gain an inside look at how advanced technology solves real business problems and creates significant value for society.  

  

You excel at seizing opportunities by taking on challenging projects related to our core products, including refining business models, optimizing product packaging, analyzing complex datasets, and participating in M&A activities. Additionally, you thrive in optimizing and streamlining internal processes, consistently seeking ways to boost efficiency and effectiveness.

### **Who we’re looking for**


As a Summer Intern, you’re a third or fourth-year student eager to dive into real-world experience at one of Europe’s largest software companies. You are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Informatics, AI, Business Administration or similar. You have a commercial mindset and are eager to join us on our mission to improve the work-life of millions of people around the world with our software.  

  

You’re a critical thinker who excels at solving complex challenges, asking insightful questions, and challenging the status quo. Whether you have a passion for coding and innovation or aspire to lead future tech projects, you’re a self-starter who thrives both independently and as part of a team. Plus, you have strong communication skills in both written and verbal Swedish and English.  

  

**Internship details**  

  

The internship runs from the middle of June until the first week of August 2025. You’ll have two weeks off in July for the holiday break.

*This programme is international, so for the first week, all interns from Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden will be together in Oslo. This will give you a chance to get to know each other and Visma, meet your colleagues, and participate in both informational courses and fun social activities! After that first week, you’ll start your project period in your home country.*


During your internship, you’ll work with real projects, so the goal is for us to continue your work after the summer is over. You’ll work in international teams and be given a high level of responsibility, while being supported by experienced colleagues. We’ll do our best to put you on a project that aligns with your competence and interests.

### **Why choose Visma?**


At Visma, we go beyond competitive terms and employee benefits. Here’s what makes us stand out.


We invest in your development. Personal and career growth are priorities here. With support from a personal mentor, former trainees, and a dedicated program leader, you'll build a solid network to rely on for guidance and development.


Experience a variety of responsibilities. One of the biggest advantages of working in Visma? We’re a network of companies, each with their own products and projects. You’ll have the opportunity to experience different responsibilities through different projects, allowing you to discover in which roles you excel.


We’re more than just colleagues. Enjoy a warm, social work culture with social activities for anyone. We invite you to a cabin trip together with the other interns, so you can all get to know each other really well and share some good memories. Your buddies will also make sure you have a blast, with fun activities planned after work!  

  

Your ideas drive us forward. We value unique insights and creativity and are not afraid of taking risks – that’s how we learn. We'll trust you to experiment, learn, and grow just as much.

### **Application process**


Instead of a traditional cover letter, we want to know: Why do you want to spend your summer as an intern in Visma, and what are the key strengths you'll bring to the programme? Share your thoughts in a paragraph or two, approximately 100-150 words. Don't forget to upload your CV and higher education grade reports; screenshots of grades are okay if official reports aren't available.


We will review applications continuously so we highly recommend you to apply as soon as possible. All applicants will receive feedback from us after the deadline. Keep an eye on your spam folder, just in case!


Once you apply, get ready to complete some ability tests. If we think we are a great match, we'll invite you to a digital interview. The final interview, including a case study, will take place at our office in Stockholm.

**Remember to apply before the deadline, November 24th 2024, 12 PM - we can't wait to hear from you!**

  




**Do you want to know more about career opportunities?** Check out our career site.

title: Sr. Enterprise Account Manager, AWS Sweden
description:
* Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management
* The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
* Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business
* University degree or a technical background in business, engineering, or computer science, BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience


Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on working with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Senior Enterprise Account Manager, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
As an AWS Senior Enterprise Account Manager, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
  
  

On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
  
  

Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
  
  

Come build the future with us.
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

About the team
  
Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
